solution_line_template: The slippers are ${slippers_price} and currently {discount_percent*100}% off so that's {slippers_price}*{discount_percent} = $<<{slippers_price}*{discount_percent}={slippers_discount}>>{slippers_discount} discount

The slippers are ${slippers_price} with a ${slippers_discount} discount which makes them {slippers_price}-{slippers_discount} = $<<{slippers_price}-{slippers_discount}={slippers_price_after_discount}>>{slippers_price_after_discount}

The embroidery will be ${embroidery_per_shoe} per shoe, and {num_shoes} shoes make a pair so it will cost {embroidery_per_shoe}*{num_shoes} = $<<{embroidery_per_shoe}*{num_shoes}={embroidery_total}>>{embroidery_total}

The shoes are on sale for ${slippers_price_after_discount}, the embroidery will be ${embroidery_total} and the shipping is ${shipping_cost} for a total of {slippers_price_after_discount}+{embroidery_total}+{shipping_cost} = $<<{slippers_price_after_discount}+{embroidery_total}+{shipping_cost}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
